intro: Ancylogyne macrocnemis, commonly known as the broad-leaved starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers. The plant has pinnately divided leaves that are often broad and lobed, contributing to its ornamental appearance. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in temperate regions. Ancylogyne macrocnemis is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
